title: The day Grok lost its mind
desc: A controversy erupted when Elon Musk shared a post about murdered white farmers in South Africa. Grok, an AI chatbot, initially debunked claims of 'white genocide'. Later, Grok strangely fixated on this topic, even in unrelated conversations. This incident highlights the unpredictable nature of AI. It also raises concerns about potential manipulation and the spread of misinformation.

title: Assam govt hands over 55,000 pucca houses, launches women mason drive
desc: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan and Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma presented 55,000 pucca houses to rural beneficiaries in Assam under PMAY-G. They launched the 'Lakhimi Mistri' initiative, training women in masonry, and inaugurated 21 knowledge centers. Assam has been allotted a target of 3,76,075 houses for FY 2025-26, aiming to achieve 'Housing for All' in rural areas.

title: Manali hotel representatives, locals demand cancellation of Turkish firm's railway survey over security, livelihood fears
desc: Representatives in Manali voice strong opposition to the Bilaspur–Manali–Leh railway survey conducted by Turkish company Yüksel Proje, citing national security risks due to Turkey's pro-Pakistan stance. Concerns also include potential damage to local horticulture, livelihoods, and the region's natural beauty. They demand immediate cancellation of the Turkish firm's involvement and a security review.

title: UP farmer's son elected mayor of market town in England
desc: Raj Mishra, originally from Mirzapur, Uttar Pradesh, has become the new mayor of Wellingborough. He won the local elections and was then elected as mayor. Mishra expresses his commitment to serving the community. He aims to foster a vibrant and inclusive town. He plans to support local charities during his term. Mishra emphasizes listening to residents and working collaboratively.

title: Assam cabinet approves land for AMUL's dairy plant
desc: The Assam government has approved land for AMUL to establish a state-of-the-art dairy plant. This plant will be set up at the Institute of Farm Management Campus, Rani. The project aims to boost dairy production in the state. It will benefit around 20,000 dairy farmers. The cabinet also approved subsidized Masur Dal, Sugar, and Salt for NFSA beneficiaries.

title: From dust to flow: UP villagers bring 81km-long dried-up river back to life
desc: In Uttar Pradesh's Bundelkhand region, the Noon river, once dry due to encroachments and poor rainfall, is being revived through community efforts. Thousands of villagers volunteered to restore the river's drainage basin, creating a funnel for water flow. Expected to fully flow soon, the revival will benefit over 15,350 farmers, restoring irrigation to farmland and providing water for animals.

title: Wheat procurement surpasses last year's level, reaches 28.66 million tonne
desc: India's wheat procurement has exceeded last year's figures, reaching 28.66 million tonne. This is the highest since 2022-23, boosted by record output projections. Punjab leads procurement, followed by Madhya Pradesh and Haryana. Payments of Rs 62,346.23 crore have been made to 2.27 million farmers. Harvesting is complete in several states, though still ongoing in others.

title: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announces Rs 380 cr package for farmers' welfare in Nagaland
desc: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced a Rs 380-crore package to boost Nagaland's agricultural sector. He urged the state government to create a detailed agriculture development plan to utilize the funds effectively. Governor La Ganesan hailed the package as transformative for rural Nagaland, emphasizing veterinary education's role in food security and sustainable livelihoods.

title: How is a 1:4.5 human-sheep ratio a problem in the making for New Zealand? All you need to know!
desc: New Zealand's sheep population is decreasing. Land use changes to dairy and forestry are key reasons. Economic factors, like lower wool prices, also contribute. Climate change and droughts affect sheep farming. Urban growth reduces agricultural land. Despite challenges, sheep remain important to New Zealand's economy. The industry is adapting to ensure its future.

title: Why was Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok preoccupied with South Africa's racial politics?
desc: Elon Musk's AI chatbot Grok sparked controversy after repeatedly referencing "white genocide" in South Africa, even in unrelated conversations. Experts suspect the responses were hard-coded, raising concerns about bias and manipulation in AI outputs. Neither Musk nor his companies have explained the glitch, prompting criticism and calls for transparency.

title: India examining US request to abolish curbs on ethanol imports
desc: India is reviewing a U.S. request to lift restrictions on ethanol imports as part of broader trade negotiations aimed at avoiding U.S. tariffs. Currently, India allows ethanol imports only for non-fuel use to support domestic production. The U.S., backed by farm lobby groups, wants access to India’s fuel ethanol market, citing trade barriers.

title: Similar actions taken for Pakistan should also be taken for Turkey: HP LoP Jairam Thakur
desc: Jairam Thakur supports Himachal Pradesh apple growers' demand. They want a ban on Turkish apple imports. Growers cite Turkey's perceived anti-India stance. They allege Turkish support for Pakistan. Ankit Bramta highlights the impact of imports on local prices. He suggests a ban could benefit Indian farmers. The demand gains traction in Shimla's apple-growing region.

title: Trade unions defer nationwide general strike to July 9
desc: The joint platform of 10-central trade unions, barring the RSS-affiliate Bhartiya Mazdoor Sangh, have deferred their proposed nationwide general strike on May 20 to July 9, 2025 citing the prevailing situation throughout the country. However, the joint platform has called for demonstrations across the state capitals at industry level on May 20.

title: Maharashtra govt to set up irradiation centres after years of battling volatile onion prices
desc: The Maharashtra government is expediting the establishment of dedicated onion irradiation centers following electoral setbacks in onion-producing regions. Farmers were upset by export controls, leading to losses for the Mahayuti alliance. This policy aims to extend onion shelf life, mitigating price volatility and enabling farmers to store and sell strategically, potentially launching centers within months.

title: Farmers in Himachal to get Rs 4 per unit power subsidy, announces state government
desc: The Himachal Pradesh government has announced a significant subsidy for agricultural consumers, reducing the electricity rate to just Rs. 1 per unit. The state government will bear the remaining cost of Rs. 4.04 per unit, demonstrating its commitment to supporting the agricultural sector.

title: UP govt targets 12 pc increase in Kharif production to 293 LT
desc: Uttar Pradesh is set to boost farmers' income with a new Kharif strategy, aiming for a 12% increase in foodgrain and oilseed production, targeting 293 lakh tonnes. The initiative focuses on improved crop planning, promoting maize and paddy, and constructing 8,500 farm ponds for water conservation. Farmers will receive technical training and access to quality seeds and fertilizers.

title: Canadians, your milk and beef might soon cost you a fortune
desc: Canadians are grappling with soaring food prices, particularly for dairy and beef, straining family budgets. Rising transportation, labor costs, and trade uncertainties, exacerbated by US trade policies, contribute to the financial pressure. While supporting local producers offers some relief, families face tough choices, with low-income households disproportionately affected and turning to food banks.

title: Gadkari calls for new law for cooperative sector to keep pace with 'evolving economic conditions'
desc: Nitin Gadkari urged Maharashtra to enact a new cooperative law reflecting current economic realities, emphasizing the sector's role in rural financial improvement. He advocated for a study on the cooperative movement's socio-economic impact, highlighting disparities in agricultural contributions to GDP. Gadkari also pointed to the dairy sector and farmer-producer companies as models for boosting rural income and employment.

title: 'Not PR. Just common sense': Sanam Teri Kasam actor Harshvardhan Rane slams Pakistani actress Marwa Hocane for her comments against India
desc: Harshvardhan Rane withdraws from 'Sanam Teri Kasam 2'. This follows Mawra Hocane's controversial comments on India's Operation Sindoor. Rane clarifies his stance after Hocane calls his exit a PR stunt. He emphasizes his zero tolerance for insults against India. Rane compares his decision to a farmer removing weeds. He asserts his right to choose collaborators.

title: Tired of importing US Lettuce, Canadian farmers turn to robots
desc: Canada heavily relies on US lettuce imports, facing supply disruptions due to droughts and rising costs. To combat this, Canadian researchers and farmers are developing a lettuce-harvesting robot. Currently being tested in southern Ontario, this AI-powered robot aims to enable year-round local lettuce production, ensuring quality, cost control, and a more secure food system for Canadians.

title: Punjab's hopes for normalcy dimmed by fresh violations
desc: Initial hope flickered in Punjab's border districts following India and Pakistan's ceasefire agreement, but late-night violations quickly revived anxiety. Blackouts and air sirens, previously constant, resumed in areas like Amritsar and Pathankot. Despite incidents like a drone attack in Ferozepur, residents maintain a resilient spirit, though farmers face challenges due to transport disruptions caused by the ongoing tensions.

title: Punjab, Haryana, UP asked to set up 'Parali Protection Force' to end stubble burning
desc: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) has directed Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh to establish a 'parali protection force' to prevent stubble burning. This force, comprising police and agricultural officers, will monitor farms, penalize offenders, and provide assistance to farmers. States are also instructed to upgrade crop residue management machines and establish paddy straw storage and supply chains.

title: Shivraj Singh Chouhan assures nation on food stocks
desc: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan assures the nation of sufficient food reserves. Agriculture reserves are operating at full capacity. He reviewed foodgrain stock and rabi crop production with officials. The focus is on boosting kharif crop production. Foodgrain output rose to 3,474.42 lakh metric tonnes in 2024-25. This is an increase from 3,322.98 lakh metric tonnes in the previous year.

title: Indo-Pak conflict: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan asks officials to assist bordering states' farmers with sowing ops
desc: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has instructed officials to help farmers in bordering states. This is due to the ongoing conflict. The ministry will assist with sowing operations. Chouhan will speak with chief ministers of Jammu and Kashmir and Punjab. The government is assessing crop needs and preparing seeds. Foodgrain stocks are sufficient, with bumper wheat production.

title: CM Yogi Adityanath, World Bank chief Banga launch two projects for farmers, youths
desc: Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and World Bank President Ajay Banga launched 'UP-AGRIS' and 'AI Pragya' to advance Uttar Pradesh. UP-AGRIS, backed by World Bank loans, will modernize farming in Purvanchal and Bundelkhand, benefiting nearly 10 lakh farmers. 'AI Pragya' aims to train 10 lakh youths in AI skills, positioning Uttar Pradesh as an AI hub and boosting its economy.

title: Govt to launch pan-India farmers awareness campaign from May 29 to boost Kharif output
desc: Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announced a 15-day pan-India campaign, 'Viksit Krishi Sankalp Abhiyan,' starting May 29, to educate farmers about modern technology and new seed varieties. The campaign aims to reach 1-1.5 crore farmers across 700 districts.

title: Govt to launch pan-India farmers awareness campaign from May 29 to boost output: Shivraj Chouhan
desc: Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan announces a nationwide campaign. It aims to educate farmers about modern farming techniques. The 'Viksit Krishi Sankalp Abhiyan' will run from May 29 to June 12. Teams will visit 700 districts. They will share information on climate-resilient seeds and government programs. The goal is to boost crop productivity and farmer income.

title: India, UK FTA: No duty concessions on British dairy products, apples, cheese
desc: India has finalized a free trade agreement with the UK, but it will not offer import duty concessions on sensitive agricultural products like dairy, apples, and cheese. This decision aims to protect Indian farmers' livelihoods, aligning with India's approach in other trade agreements, including the EFTA pact where similar concessions were withheld.

title: Tension along International Border: Farmers rush to wrap up harvest
desc: Farmers along the Jammu and Kashmir International Border are urgently harvesting crops amidst heightened tensions following the Pahalgam terror attack. With most of the harvest complete, they are racing to package and transport their produce, fearing renewed shelling. Labor shortages and memories of past conflicts add to the anxiety as they strive to secure their livelihoods.
